subject: What after Hacktoberfest?
header: Finally the fun is over and immediate question comes to my mind, what next? Well as per the tradition, the next big thing is "24 Pull Request". For that we have to wait another month. It is a nice break before you start the marathon again. I haven't had much fun with Hacktoberfest this time. How about you? Please do share your story with us when you get time.

This time around every year, we hold London Perl Workshop. But for the known reason to all, it has been skipped. I am already missing the fun day to meet great minds. I pray that we get back to normal soon and start attending the annual meet. Talking about event, we missed the European Perl/Raku event supposed to be happen in Amsterdam this year. I hope we would get the opportunity meet next year.

If you are looking for fun challenge to keep you busy then why not give a try to The Weekly Challenge. You will find plenty to keep you busy all week. Please don't forget to share your experience with us.
Last but not the least, you please take care of yourself and your family. Enjoy the rest of the newsletter.

entries.title: Monthly Report - October
entries.author: mohammad_anwar
entries.text: It is time for monthly report now. Keeping the tradition un-interrupted.

chapters.title: Perl Weekly Challenge
chapters.header: The Weekly Challenge by Mohammad Anwar will help you step out from your comfort-zone. You can even win the prize money of $50 Amazon voucher by participating in the weekly challenge. We pick one winner at the end of the month among all the contributors of the month. The monthly prize is kindly sponsored by Peter Sergeant of PerlCareers.

entries.author: mohammad_anwar
entries.text: Welcome new week with couple of fun tasks "Triplet Sum" and "Power of Two Integers". If you are new to the weekly challenge then why not join us and have fun every week. For more information, please read FAQ page.
entries.title: The Weekly Challenge - 085

entries.author: mohammad_anwar
entries.text: Enjoy quick recap of last week contributions by the Team PWC dealing with the "Reverse Integer" and "Find Square" tasks in Perl and Raku. You will find plenty of solutions to keep you busy.

chapters.title: Perl Tutorial
chapters.header: A section for newbies and for people who need some refreshing of their Perl knowledge. If you have questions or suggestions about the articles, let me know and I'll try to make the necessary changes. The included articles are from the Perl Maven Tutorial and are part of the Perl Maven eBook.
